Articles.Content: I'm looking for a mod that would be similar to the studio in GTAV, where you can set it to record, then stop recording when you're done, and move the camera around in your recording. Not sure if you know what I mean, but any help is appreciated!

Hello there. c:

To my knowledge, there isn't really an addon that records specifically, so it will likely require a third-party program for recording. (Bandicam, Fraps, etc.)

However, there definitely is options for camera tools, with some nice options for cinematics. They will take a little getting used to, but you can use them together, even with the latest version of KSP. (1.0.2) Here's a couple of the options that seem to be the best among most people, at least to what I see. Maybe you've seen them, or maybe not. These two:

"CameraTools"

http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/220346-kerbcam And "KerbCam"

Here's a decent tutorial for the KerbCam at least, and CameraTools (not related to KerbCam, just a side note, and personal preference) is fairly simple once you understand the options.

Hope I've been a help, best of wishes. c:

sounds like the OP is wanting to record replays of missions, so they can then replay them and adjust camera angles etc afterwards.

@4j25:

I don't think there's any single thing yet that allows multiple cameras to record simultaneously while playing the game. The mods linked above just provide different camera angles you set up in advance and then switch between in-game, but recording would still be a sequential screen capture so you'd have to script out your camera changes to end up with what you wanted from a single take, or make multiple takes and cut and paste them together.
Thanks for all the replies, and yes mrklaw, that is exactly what I'm talking about. I'll try some of those out.

Persistent Trails. I haven't actually tried it, but that's what you want. (the name doesn't exactly get that point across, in my opinion). Don't know if it rewinds time to the proper timeframe or not, though.
